column4: HOw do I check for hard disk errors (Physical)?  (In Winblow it was chkdsk /f/r )
how do I get part name?

Well my issue is I am trying to install mythubuntu and I got an IO error.  The error said it could be the CD or the hard drive, but since I pulled this PC off a shelf its been sitting on for like a year I wanted to make sure the hard drive was okay before I go wasting disks
I dont think it finished tho
it was 48 % thru, than I got the IO error than I went to get a drink and the installer was gone
is there a way to do an integrity check on the disk?
When you boot there should be a boot and verify option
What speed did you burn the disc at
Try to reburn the image on a disc that supports 2.4x and burn it that slow
But like I said, try reburning the ISO at 2.4x
Generally a slower burn speed results in less chance of the disc failing
For future advice, NEVER burn an ISO image at full write speed.
